availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Frost (Hopkins County, KY, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Lucinda Ray Frost in Mercer County, Kentucky, in October 1827. Father of Juliet Frost, John H. Frost, and Mary E. Frost. Married to Mary J. Frost. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Madisonville in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 52A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 695.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 829-30.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 209A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, 1825-1830, Film #000191851.
"Lucinda Frost (1809-1846)," Find A Grave, Memorial #67162231, accessed November 12, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67162231.
